title: [ENH] parameter defaults for distances in classification/clustering module - deal with that by sklearn objects
body:
From TSC KNN:

```
todo: add a utility method to set keyword args for distance measure parameters.
(e.g.  handle the parameter name(s) that are passed as metric_params automatically,
depending on what distance measure is used in the classifier (e.g. know that it is w
for dtw, c for msm, etc.). Also allow long-format specification for
non-standard/user-defined measures e.g. set_distance_params(measure_type=None,
param_values_to_set=None,
param_names=None)
```

I would argue that this is no longer needed since we can pass `BaseObject` distances, where parameter defaults can be defined as with any other `sklearn` compatible estimator.

I think this "todo" dates from a time where the point about making distances `BaseObject`-s was not very clear.

I.e., this tries to answer a problem of the old design (pass by string reference rather than as sklearn object) with a hacky solution (also pass the parameters), instead going for the in hindsight obvious and "clean" solution of passing class & parameters via sklearn object.

I would argue to remove this as solved (sklearn objects can be passed) and outdated (composites should be exposed as sklearn composites and not via custom blown-up interfaces).

In similar locations, the same changes as to `KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier` should be applied, instead of going down the proposed above route.

FYI @MatthewMiddlehurst, @chrisholder. FYI @Lovkush-A who reviewed `KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier`.
